text: Frank Joseph Varrichione (pronounced "Vair-akee-oh'-nee,"Steve Snider (UPI), "Jawbreaker Names Still on Irish Roster," Baytown [TX] Sun, Sept. 27, 1951, pg. 27. January 14, 1932 - January 6, 2018) was an American athlete. He was born in Natick, Massachusetts. He played eleven seasons in the National Football League (NFL). He played for the Pittsburgh Steelers from 1955 through 1960 and with the Los Angeles Rams from 1961 to 1965. Varrichione died on January 6, 2018 in Framingham, Massachusetts of skin cancer at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from skin cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Massachusetts Category:Pittsburgh Steelers players Category:Los Angeles Rams players Category:Sportspeople from Massachusetts
title: Frank Varrichione
